content: And based on the guidance versus the actual performance in Q1, we already said at the Q2 EBITDA will be negative $90 million to $100 million versus our actual Q1 with $40 million. And I think the -- from a cash flow standpoint, we think the cash -- so Q1, there is some one-time cash consumption that we do not expect to reoccur in Q2 -- but in Q2, if the EBITDA is lower than Q1, so that's a headwind from cash plan for Q2.
